message.content:
cs.GT, cs.DS, cs.CG, cs.DM, cs.SY 

Reasoning: 
1. cs.GT (Computer Science and Game Theory) - The problem of chasing convex bodies can be seen as a game between the algorithm and the sequence of convex bodies. The objective of the algorithm is to minimize the total distance between successive points, which can be seen as a cost function. Therefore, this paper can be categorized under cs.GT. 
2. cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) - The problem of chasing convex bodies involves designing an algorithm that responds with points in an online fashion. This requires the use of efficient data structures and algorithms. Therefore, this paper can be categorized under cs.DS. 
3. cs.CG (Computational Geometry) - The problem of chasing convex bodies involves working with convex bodies in high-dimensional space. This requires the use of computational geometry techniques. Therefore, this paper can be categorized under cs.CG. 
4. cs.DM (Discrete Mathematics) - The problem of chasing convex bodies involves discrete objects (convex bodies) and a discrete sequence of actions (choosing points). Therefore, this paper can be categorized under cs.DM. 
5. cs.SY (Systems and Control) - The problem of chasing convex bodies can be seen as a control problem, where the algorithm tries to control the movement of the convex bodies by choosing points. Therefore, this paper can be categorized under cs.SY.
